programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 17-month-old Josh Hinson died in a fire which a federal agency ruled was intentionally set by Josh's mother Terri Strickland. Using the then-emerging resources of the Internet, Terri Strickland undertook her own investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An infant was rushed to a Cleveland emergency room with serious breathing problems. The baby's lungs were bleeding. Within months, there were more than 30 cases -- an incidence more than a thousand times higher than anywhere else in the world. Doctors had never seen anything like it, and searched frantically for the cause and a cure.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In this classic episode of Forensic Files, the longest running true crime series in television history, a serial bomber was waging a vendetta against the legal profession: A judge, two attorneys and even a courthouse had been targeted. Employing a range of forensic techniques, investigators used evidence from the bombs to lead them to the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1980, Michigan resident Shannon Mohr died in what was reported to be a horseback riding accident by her new husband David Davis. After her death, Shannon's family reported to police their suspicions that Davis seemed far from grief-stricken.¬æ

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When 19-year-old Lori Auker left her Pennsylvania home for work and never arrived, it took space-age technology, cat hairs and insects to pinpoint the image of the woman's abductor.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a day of fishing in a small, quiet village in Switzerland, a teenage boy did not return home as planned. The investigation revealed some important microscopic evidence in the water near where he was last seen. It was the only forensic evidence detectives had. But would it be enough for them to find him?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman goes missing on the way to the train station, investigators use a strand of hair and a bloody pillowcase to find a suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This examination of the role an autopsy plays in a murder investigation focuses on the suspicious 1997 death of Georgia resident Virginia Ridley. Police charged her mentally unstable husband Alan with murder, but a medical examiner discovered that she died of natural causes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nancy Newman and her two young daughters are found brutally murdered and sexually violated in their Anchorage, AK home. Investigators cannot find a conclusive link to their prime suspect. To solve the puzzle, an FBI analyst designs an unique experiment, in which pubic hairs found at the scene are used to establish not only that Kirby Anthoney was in the home, but that he was there when the crime was committed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 16-month-old Anne Grace Gimmenstad became very ill, was rushed to the hospital and died within two weeks. Following extensive medical examinations, it was determined that Anna had been the victim of the deadly bacteria E.coli.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Evidence reveals a teacher who complained of being stalked and harassed by another teacher was scamming police.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: One investigator's quick thinking helps him capture a shoe impression made in snow before the evidence melts away. The shoe leads investigators to Peter Benedict and Frank Lanoue, who are convicted of aggravated assault and robbery.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An 11-year-old boy comes down with a fever and diarrhea after eating an undercooked burger; when his condition worsens, his mother drives him to a hospital and doctors discover E. coli destroying his body.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, Robert Curley was diagnosed with Guillain_Barr_ syndrome when he arrived at the hospital with excruciating leg pains. However, doctors became suspicious during Robert's second admission and tested him for Thallium poisoning, which proved positive and Robert died shortly thereafter. Autopsy showed that Robert ingested more poison a few days before his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In rural Canada, Dr. John Schneeberger is accused of sedating and sexually assaulting one of his female patients and his step daughter. DNA tests demonstrate that the doctor is innocent, but the patient insists that he sedated and raped her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1992, 22-year-old Dawn Bruce is brutally murdered in her Virginia apartment. Investigators notice a blood smear on a pillow case that appears to have been made by one of the killer's fingers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a prosecutor discovers evidence linking a habitual drunk driver to a hit-and-run in which a child is killed, he combines the talents of an accident reconstruction expert with a video specialist. This case was the first in which video in the courtroom withstood an appeal, and helped make 'video testimony' viable in other cases.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In a quiet village in Great Britain, a farmer came upon a chilling sight. Impaled on his fence post was a severed lamb's head along with a note which read, "You next." programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a human skull and some bones were discovered at a Boy Scout Camp near Farmington, Missouri. A facial reconstruction aided the investigators in this case. programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Soon-to-be-married David and Justin both work long hours in education. When the school year is over, they go abroad for adventure. Kinga shows them there is plenty to do in their own backyard in Cincinnati.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: In Orlando, nothing is as it seems. For three special effects artists, it's all on the line as they compete to create an Orlando-inspired theme park character. Little do they know, things are about to get hairy.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Beach-inspired resin art in Boston, and elaborate charcuterie boards in Omaha.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin gets wedged in a wild Arkansas cave and Ryan can't help but laugh. Above ground, the team spreads kindness in a rural community, gives a man a guitar worth singing about, and Jimmy Luv finds courage to confess his crush to an Olympian.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal‚Äôs and a casino magnate‚Äôs family forever.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero asks contestants about real news stories with unreal outcomes for a chance at a cash prize. In "Family Care," locals learn about a resourceful rescue, a bold family tradition and mother-son musicians.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Meet Gary and Karen, he‚Äôs a little adventurous, and she‚Äôs a little stay-at-home, but it will all change after 12 years of marriage. Kinga, Gary, and Karen embark on a crash course in adventure through the Granite State.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda joins Sage Cornelius, an Indigenous fiddle player with a love for heavy metal. Watch as they spend the day exploring the city‚Äôs rich Vietnamese food scene, an impromptu concert at a favorite local venue, and a bit of supervised mayhem.

programme.title: Queens of Birmingham
programme.desc: Queens of Birmingham invites you to slip into your high heels and sashay over the rainbow. Join the DREAMCAST of Al's on 7th, the region's preeminent drag bar, and meet the fiercest divas in the South.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Kate learns how to play a Germantown street game, gets up close and personal with handcrafted, hand-charred bourbon barrels, and learns to fall back in love with whiskey ‚Äì and natural wine.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A serial killer preys on women from a hardscrabble section of Daytona Beach, Florida. Detectives have boxes of DNA and ballistic evidence. They just don't have a suspect.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan take you backstage and give a unique view of their winter tour in New Hampshire. See what it takes to make their show a smashing success!

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero takes to the streets to quiz people on the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Imagination Station," contestants answer questions for cash about witty co-workers, life-saving screenings and teaching telemarketers a lesson.

programme.title: The Roller Coaster Wars That Birthed a Beast
programme.desc: In 2006, two dozen roller coaster riders landed in the hospital after a freak malfunction in Ohio. This is the story of Kings Island: how its thrilling ‚Äì and sometimes nail-biting ‚Äì history spawned one of America‚Äôs greatest amusement parks.

programme.title: Ora 4X

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other‚Äôs signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent‚Äôs creation.

programme.title: Plate It!

programme.desc: After eight members of one family were killed in their homes in a single night, residents of the devastated Ohio community were left to wonder if they were next.

programme.title: Rickwood
programme.desc: This is the story of the oldest professional ballpark in the U.S. and the determination of its home team, the Black Barons. The voice of Rickwood tells the tale of its pivotal role in The Negro League, Black history and its legacy in American sports.

programme.title: Escaping The Blade

programme.title: Grit of Greenwood
programme.desc: Greenwood was a thriving Black district in Tulsa when, 100 years ago, it was destroyed in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented ‚Äúfor the picking.‚Äù From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal‚Äôs and a casino magnate‚Äôs family forever.

programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.desc: Justin gets wedged in a wild Arkansas cave and Ryan can't help but laugh. Above ground, the team spreads kindness in a rural community, gives a man a guitar worth singing about, and Jimmy Luv finds courage to confess his crush to an Olympian.

programme.title: The Middle Child

programme.title: Free Spirit

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy

programme.title: Apocalypse 101
programme.desc: Could you find a way to survive in a post-apocalyptic world? Explore what it would take to stay alive following a global cataclysm, and what knowledge we would need to rebuild civilization as we know it.

programme.title: Ketamine: From Street Drug To Lifesaver
programme.desc: Suicide is the 2nd leading cause of death in the world for those aged 15-24 years. Now, there may be a new tool in fighting depression. It's the 50-year-old anesthetic, Ketamine.

programme.title: World Without Water
programme.desc: Hundreds of millions of people around the world could run out of water soon. Experts are desperately searching for solutions to stave off "Day Zero" when the taps will run dry.

programme.title: Return Of The Wolves
programme.desc: Capture teams from the U.S. National Park Service track down and relocate wolves to Isle Royale National Park in Lake Superior under an ambitious initiative to restore balance to a wilderness ecosystem.

programme.title: Night Caller
programme.desc: In upstate New York a school superintendent's new relationship ends in terror, and in Houston, TX a wife buries her troubled past.

programme.title: Smoke And Mirrors
programme.desc: In West Virginia a marriage goes up in smoke after an affair, while in Raleigh, NC a romantic stroll in the park turns to terror.

programme.title: Operation Black Biscuit: Infiltrating The Hells Angels
programme.desc: ATF agent Jay Dobyns infiltrates the notorious Hell's Angels motorcycle club in the midst of a deadly biker war over drug profits and territory. Dobyns must first pass a series of tests to determine if he's worthy of wearing Angels' colors and running with the pack. To collect evidence against the gang, the ATF agent must outsmart the club at its own game. But in doing so, Dobyns places a target on his back and puts his family in harm's way.

programme.title: Operation Cayman: Drug Smuggling On The High Seas
programme.desc: South Florida lawman, Jim Sweeting, partners with the DEA to infiltrate a network of drug dealers moving pot and coke via the Cayman Islands. Sweeting leap-frogs from dealer to dealer, busting them one at a time and moving closer to cutting off the Cayman connection. The operation is a minefield of bureaucratic roadblocks and gun wielding traffickers that Sweeting must juggle, while staying inside the lines of the law. If he makes a mistake and his identity is revealed, it will mean certain death.

programme.title: Operation Mr. Untouchable: Dethroning Harlem's Heroin King
programme.desc: Nicky Barnes is Harlem's Heroin King. After serving time in jail for drug dealing, Barnes has learned ways to make himself untouchable and his drug empire is such big business that even the President of the United States has taken notice. It will take patience and street smarts for DEA agent, Louis Diaz, to unravel the viper's nest of Barnes' associates and bring them all to justice - and for Diaz himself to stay alive.

programme.title: Operation Greylord: Undercover In The Halls Of Injustice
programme.desc: State prosecutor Terry Hake fulfills a lifelong dream by going undercover for the FBI in Chicago. Hake works tirelessly to expose rampant corruption in the Cook County court system. Wearing a wire, he befriends and bribes crooked judges, lawyers, and bailiffs who participate in a pay-to-play perversion of justice. All told, his work results in the indictments of 92 public officials in what many call the largest government corruption case in history.

programme.title: Operation Cayman: Drug Smuggling On The High Seas
programme.desc: South Florida lawman, Jim Sweeting, partners with the DEA to infiltrate a network of drug dealers moving pot and coke via the Cayman Islands. Sweeting leap-frogs from dealer to dealer, busting them one at a time and moving closer to cutting off the Cayman connection. The operation is a minefield of bureaucratic roadblocks and gun wielding traffickers that Sweeting must juggle, while staying inside the lines of the law. If he makes a mistake and his identity is revealed, it will mean certain death.

programme.title: Operation Mr. Untouchable: Dethroning Harlem's Heroin King
programme.desc: Nicky Barnes is Harlem's Heroin King. After serving time in jail for drug dealing, Barnes has learned ways to make himself untouchable and his drug empire is such big business that even the President of the United States has taken notice. It will take patience and street smarts for DEA agent, Louis Diaz, to unravel the viper's nest of Barnes' associates and bring them all to justice - and for Diaz himself to stay alive.

programme.title: Operation Greylord: Undercover In The Halls Of Injustice
programme.desc: State prosecutor Terry Hake fulfills a lifelong dream by going undercover for the FBI in Chicago. Hake works tirelessly to expose rampant corruption in the Cook County court system. Wearing a wire, he befriends and bribes crooked judges, lawyers, and bailiffs who participate in a pay-to-play perversion of justice. All told, his work results in the indictments of 92 public officials in what many call the largest government corruption case in history.
